articles.headline: Seeking to Unsettle Russia, Macron Provokes Allies
articles.snippet: The French president’s openness to Western troops in Ukraine signaled a quest for military resolve. But some allies felt blindsided.
articles.abstract: The French president’s openness to Western troops in Ukraine signaled a quest for military resolve. But some allies felt blindsided.
articles.lead_paragraph: With his jolting unexpected statement that sending Western troops to Ukraine “should not be ruled out,” President Emmanuel Macron of France has shattered a taboo, ignited debate, spread dismay among allies and forced a reckoning on Europe’s future.

articles.headline: McConnell to Step Down as Leader at the End of the Year
articles.snippet: The long-serving Republican leader said he would step aside from the role at the end of his term but remain in the Senate, acknowledging that his views on national security had put him out of step with his party.
articles.abstract: The long-serving Republican leader said he would step aside from the role at the end of his term but remain in the Senate, acknowledging that his views on national security had put him out of step with his party.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Mitch McConnell, the longtime top Senate Republican, said on Wednesday that he would give up his spot as the party’s leader following the November elections, acknowledging that his Reaganite national security views had put him out of step with a party now headed by former President Donald J. Trump.

articles.headline: Biden’s Gaza Challenge Will Persist, but Michigan May Have Been Unique
articles.snippet: Democratic unease with the president’s handling of the Mideast war will continue to trail him, but his allies hope that no other state on the primary calendar will present the same challenges.
articles.abstract: Democratic unease with the president’s handling of the Mideast war will continue to trail him, but his allies hope that no other state on the primary calendar will present the same challenges.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden and his allies had reasons for both hope and concern after a Michigan primary election that revealed the party’s painful divisions over the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and confronted him with his largest measure of Democratic opposition to date.
articles.byline: By Reid J. Epstein, Jonathan Weisman and Nicholas Nehamas

articles.headline: Supreme Court Agrees to Hear Trump’s Immunity Claim, Setting Arguments for April
articles.snippet: The former president’s trial on charges of plotting to subvert the 2020 election will remain on hold while the justices consider the matter.
articles.abstract: The former president’s trial on charges of plotting to subvert the 2020 election will remain on hold while the justices consider the matter.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Wednesday agreed to decide whether former President Donald J. Trump is immune from prosecution on charges of plotting to overturn the 2020 election, further delaying his criminal trial as it considers the matter.
